intro: Agathyrsus lapponicus, commonly known as the Lapland pincushion, is a flowering plant native to the Arctic and subarctic regions. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and thrives in cold, harsh environments. It has a low-growing habit with dense, woolly foliage that helps insulate it from extreme temperatures. Agathyrsus lapponicus is often found in tundra and alpine habitats, where it plays a role in local ecosystems.
